result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Elements
State's Exhibit #1 - plea negotiations

11:32 AM  Prosecuting attorney John Luetscher in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark F. Derouin in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard S Zoellner in court for Mark F. Derouin. State's Exhibit #1 - plea negotiations marked/received/reviewed by the Court. Counsel and defendant understand the negotiations. Defendant waives formal reading of amended information. Court reviews count 1 w/ defendant. Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY to count 1. Per plea negotiations, count 2 DRI. Court reviews doc # 39 (PLQ) w/ defendant. Voting and firearm warnings given. Court finds defendant's plea to be made freely and voluntarily and accepts the plea. Factual basis. Adjudged guilty. Court orders PSI. Defendant ordered to appear at next hrg. Present bond cont'd.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

02:32 PM Defendant Mark F. Derouin, in custody, in court with attorney Richard S Zoellner.  Edward Daniel Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received a copy of the Information, waives a formal reading and enters pleas of NOT GUILTY. Defendant request jury trial. Present bond cont'd. Defendant shall not possess/consume alcohol, possess/consume any illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia/controlled substances without a valid prescription. No direct or indirect contact w/ MB or the residence.

03:12 PM Defendant Mark F. Derouin in court, in custody, with attorney Richard S Zoellner.  Edward Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zoellner heard on his bond motion. Response by DA Burke. Court amends monetary condition of cash bond. All non monetary conditions remain the same.

02:59 PM Defendant Mark F. Derouin in court, in custody, with attorney Richard S Zoellner.  Edward Burke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Deputy Dryja who is sworn and testifies. Cross exam by Atty Zoellner. Court questions witness. Redirect by DA Burke. Witness excused. No other evidence. Court finds probable cause a felony has been committed by this defendant and defendant is bound over to the circuit court. Court proceeds w/ BBH.  Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
